entry.title: La Francophonie adopts resolution supporting Armenia, sparking outrage in Baku

media:group.media:title: La Francophonie adopts resolution supporting Armenia, sparking outrage in Baku
media:group.media:description:
üìç The International Organization of the Francophonie adopted a resolution on Saturday, calling for peace and expressing solidarity with Armenia. üìç Armenia confirmed it has no territorial claims toward Azerbaijan yet again on Monday. üìç Interview with Mathew Zein: https://youtu.be/OIJPfCyeoJw üìç Can Turkey Be Reformed?: civilnet.am/en/news/799942/can-turkey-be-reformed

entry.title: How to Manage US-Russian Rivalry Responsibly

media:group.media:title: How to Manage US-Russian Rivalry Responsibly
media:group.media:description:
Thomas Graham, special assistant to the U.S. president on Russia from 2004 to 2007, gave a talk on ‚ÄúHow to Manage US-Russian Rivalry Responsibly‚Äù at a symposium organized by the Monterey Initiative in Russian Studies at the Middlebury Institute of International Studies at Monterey. The lecture took place on July 8 in Tbilisi.
Thomas Graham is currently a distinguished fellow at the Council on Foreign Relations.
This year‚Äôs Monterey Summer Symposium on Russia took place in Yerevan, Tbilisi, and Istanbul from July 1 to July 20.

entry.title: AGBU's frontline work with Artsakh refugees

media:group.media:title: AGBU's frontline work with Artsakh refugees
media:group.media:description:
Arda Nazerian Haratunian, a strategic communications advisor, board member of the American University of Armenia, and executive staff of AGBU‚Äôs Central Board of Directors, provides an intimate look into AGBU's multifaceted response to the Artsakh crisis, from immediate humanitarian aid to long-term resettlement and integration programs. This conversation not only highlights AGBU's impactful initiatives like the Claudia Nazarian Medical Centre, LEAP, and Camp Nairi, but also addresses the broader implications for Armenia's future and the international community's role in supporting this humanitarian cause.

entry.title: Armenia‚Äôs hidden perks for remote workers

media:group.media:title: Armenia‚Äôs hidden perks for remote workers
media:group.media:description:
In this conversation, Mathew Zein, founder of Life in Armenia magazine, unveils the hidden potential of Armenia as a premier destination for digital nomads and remote-working families. Zein explores the unique advantages of living and working in Armenia, from its rich cultural heritage to its modern infrastructure and welcoming community. This discussion paints a vivid picture of how Armenia is positioning itself at the forefront of the global remote work revolution, offering a compelling blend of history, technology, and quality of life.
